Detailed Description

template<class ValueT, class WeightT = ValueT>
class imath::TWeightedNumber< ValueT, WeightT >

This class implements number with a weight and related arithmetic operations.

template<class ValueT , class WeightT >
bool imath::TWeightedNumber< ValueT, WeightT >::IsImportant ( ) const [inline]

Checks if this value is importantant.

It is true, of weight is bigger than imath_EPSYLON.

Definition at line 284 of file TWeightedNumber.h.

template<class ValueT , class WeightT >
void imath::TWeightedNumber< ValueT, WeightT >::SimpleAdd ( const TWeightedNumber< ValueT, WeightT > &  value) [inline]

Simple add operation.

Difference between operator+ and this method is, that operator+ return a value with weight which sum of weights is, but this method is faster and returns value with undefined weight, but correct real value. It means, when you are interested only in real value, than you can use this method.

Definition at line 359 of file TWeightedNumber.h.

template<class ValueT , class WeightT >
void imath::TWeightedNumber< ValueT, WeightT >::SimpleSub ( const TWeightedNumber< ValueT, WeightT > &  value)

Simple subtraction operation.

Difference between operator- and this method is, that operator- return a value with weight which sum of weights is, but this is faster and returns value with undefined weight, but correct real value. It means, when you are interested only in real value, than you can use this method.

Definition at line 386 of file TWeightedNumber.h.

void imath::TWeightedNumber< ValueT, WeightT >::Sub ( const TWeightedNumber< ValueT, WeightT > &  value) [inline]

Do Subtraction.

Please note, that operator-= calculte only simple difference of coefficients.
